epfl.lia.logist.logging
Class LogDescriptor

java.lang.Object
  epfl.lia.logist.logging.LogDescriptor

public class LogDescriptor
extends java.lang.Object

A log descriptor structure contains the fields necessary to describe a log file.

Field Summary
 int CacheSize
          The number of entries cached before writing to disk.
 java.lang.String DebugLevel

 java.lang.String ID
          The name of this log entry
 int MaxEntries
          The maximum number of entries for this log.
 boolean ToStdout
          Indicate if the log entries also should be displayed in the main stdout console.

Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Field Detail

ID

public java.lang.String ID
The name of this log entry

File

public java.lang.String File
The file storing the log data. This file is not used for stream log files.

Format

public java.lang.String Format
The format used to format entries in a log file. Possible entries are:
  • xml for xml formatted output files
  • rtf for richtext colored output files
  • raw for raw text output files
  • stream for output on stream
  • custom for custom formatted output files

FormatClass

public java.lang.String FormatClass
The name of the formatting class. This field is only used for custom output formats or for streams.

DebugLevel

public java.lang.String DebugLevel
The lowest possible severity level. The debug level can be one of the values:
  • DEBUG
  • INFO
  • WARNING
  • ERROR
  • FATAL

MaxEntries

public int MaxEntries
The maximum number of entries for this log. If the number of entries overflows the maximum number of entries, then no other entry is appended.

CacheSize

public int CacheSize
The number of entries cached before writing to disk. The cache is used to hide disk access latency

ToStdout

public boolean ToStdout
Indicate if the log entries also should be displayed in the main stdout console.

Constructor Detail

LogDescriptor

public LogDescriptor()
